      this is an ugly hack because Real Disbursements + Actual Disbursements are both fetched off the same data source and are basically cloned with somewhat differing metadata

      This merge method will perform the operation without instantiating a third Cell.
      void mergeWithCell(AmountCell anoth)
      a well-specified variant of AmountCell.merge(Cell, Cell), which is used inconsistently through AMP with regarding to who is the source and who is the destination TODO in AMP 2.8, mergeCell(cell1, cell2) should be deleted altogether and replaced by uses of either this function or AmountCell.merge(Cell) - too risky of a change to do in AMP 2.6

      • mergeWithCell

        public void mergeWithCell(AmountCell anoth)
        Description copied from class: AmountCell
        a well-specified variant of AmountCell.merge(Cell, Cell), which is used inconsistently through AMP with regarding to who is the source and who is the destination TODO in AMP 2.8, mergeCell(cell1, cell2) should be deleted altogether and replaced by uses of either this function or AmountCell.merge(Cell) - too risky of a change to do in AMP 2.6
        Overrides:
        mergeWithCell in class AmountCell

      • filter

        public Cell filter(Cell metaCell,
                   java.util.Set ids)
        Description copied from class: Cell
        Hierarchy filtering method that in most cases returns the Cell object itself. It is used to create the destination Cell in step 2 (data processing) when hierarchy views are needed. Creating hierarchy views means basically creating more reports into one, thus totals are different and Cells must be cloned.
        Overrides:
        filter in class AmountCell
        Returns:
        the resulting Cell
        See Also:
        ReportData

      • isGlobalAmount

        public boolean isGlobalAmount()
        returns true IFF this cell holds an amount which is not splitable by hier. Examples: ACTUAL PLEDGE (total amount pledged for a pledge)
